Subjective: Hard stools for 3 months; 2-3 days without bowel movement; abdominal cramps; bloating; no blood in stool; no change in eating habits; underweight; no weight loss; no fever; no nausea; no vomiting; no blood in stool; no change in urination; regular periods; Request: Concern about seriousness; wants advice on softening stools; interested in dietitian follow-up.
Objective: Abdomen: soft; no tenderness; no rebound; no guarding; bowel sounds normal; no palpable masses; no organomegaly.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) - constipation predominant; No alarm signs (no weight loss, no blood, no fever).
Plan: Psyllium fibre sachets daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks.
Follow-up in 6 weeks to assess response.
Safety net: If abdominal pain worsens, fever, or blood in stool, return sooner.
Discuss dietitian referral at next visit.
